#summary Widget description

= Introduction =

The source Widget can display text and images based on data found in the internet


= Details =

The widget are small configuration files in which a user can put a specific set of text and images feeded by data on the internet (provieded by a webservice of RSS feed)

Here is an example
{{{
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<ws4gl updatefrequency="1" width="400" height="300" bgalpha="#99" bgcolor="#0000ff" xmldataurl="http://someurl.com/data.xml">
    <name>Wheater 4 WebcamStudio</name>
    <description>Display your local weather in WebcamStudio</description>
    <author>Patrick Balleux</author>
    <image url="http://someurl.com/image.png" width="400" height="300" x="0" y="0"/>
    <text x="0" y="200" fontsize="24" color="#ffff00" fontname="Monospaced" bold="false" italic="false">Current Temp: [local.temp]</text>
</ws4gl>
}}}

Using the tags, it is possible to build complex widget in which information can be display in a fancy way.
